enrichment.AboutCourse:
Primary [5-11]\r
\r
“The secret of genius is to carry the spirit of the child into old age which means never losing your enthusiasm.”\r
Aldous Huxley [Writer]\r
\r
Train to be a primary school teacher and enjoy a rewarding career teaching children aged between five and 11 years. We will build your knowledge and teaching ability so that you can become a confident and inspiring practitioner, with the ability to spark children's imaginations and learning.\r
\r
We have been identified as one of the leading teacher training providers in England. We are one of only 25 universities to have had their initial teacher training allocations confirmed for the next three years, an acknowledgement by the Department for Education of their excellent provision.\r
\r
This course will provide training in all primary stage National Curriculum subjects, with a particular focus on the core subjects of English, mathematics and science. You will explore established educational theories alongside new ideas, concepts and developments in the field of education. Rigorous academic study on campus will be complemented by a range of practical teaching experiences to really enhance your professional development.\r
\r
On campus, you will be supported by expert tutors who will help to refine your subject knowledge and teaching practice. Working in schools, you will be supported by school-based mentors and experienced teachers as you put your learning into practice and really hone your teaching skills. \r
\r
School Direct: For the vast majority of your course, you will be based in your alliance school or schools, learning on the job while being supported by experienced teachers and mentors. You will attend university at Headingley Campus for key seminars on subject knowledge and teaching for your chosen age range, with additional sessions for three masters modules. University sessions will take place in the autumn term and will reduce as a greater amount of your time is spent in school.
enrichment.Qualifications:
Minimum Degree Required: Upper Second.\r
\r
G.C.S.E Grade C minimum [or equivalent] in English, Maths and Science\r
\r
Successful candidates must have passed the literacy and numeracy skills tests prior to starting the course and are advised to secure this as soon as possible.
enrichment.InterviewProcess:
Mills Hill Primary School - Schools with Schools Teaching School Alliance operates a simple interview process. Candidates who meet our entry requirements will be invited to Mills Hill where they will deliver a short teaching session to around 15 children. This will be to plan a session based around a book for 20 minutes. This will be observed by a member of school staff.\r
There will be brief tests in maths, spelling and writing as well as a formal interview. Decisions are based on the whole process and difficulties with one of the activities will not result in an unsuccessful outcome.\r
We are keen to identify candidates with clear potential to become excellent teachers of the future.
enrichment.PersonalQualities:
We firmly believe in delivering the best possible outcomes for our children and we are privileged to work with the next generation of teachers in order to shape both the learning and teaching of the future.  \r
\r
You will have a commitment to our children and  have had some experience of working with children in schools or similar settings. A positive attitude to lifelong learning and the academic ability to sustain their study are both essential. Teaching requires commitment, hard work and dedication but, as a reward for these efforts, brings great personal satisfaction in a job well done.
enrichment.HowSchoolPlacementsWork:
You will complete placements in two of our partner schools, which are all within 15 minutes drive of each other. Each school has an experienced mentor and your development will be overseen by the assistant head of Mills Hill. \r
There are 3 placements in total in two contrasting schools. The main placement is in the Autumn term and later in the year the Summer term while the second placement occurs in a contrasting school in the Spring term\r
Additionally, we provide additional experience in Kingfisher Special School and a nearbye secondary school. \r
Exact timings vary from year to year but on average, you will spend Thursday and Fridays until October half term in Leeds Beckett, Fridays until Christmas in Leeds and pretty much the rest of the time in one of your allocated schools.

inst.TrainWithUs:
In partnership with Leeds Beckett University we provide school direct teacher training placements across a small local cluster. Our assistant Head teacher performs the role of cluster co-ordinator. We take great pride in the quality of our trainees and prepare them well for their future career \r
Mills Hill Primary School is the lead school of a cluster of primary schools in Oldham delivering highly successful initial teacher training.  We are a National Teaching School and part of a National Teaching School Alliance with Kingfisher Special School, Yew Tree Primary School and Burnley Brow Primary School. Both Mills Hill and Kingfisher are National Teaching Schools and  are currently judged to be outstanding.\r
The alliance has been heavily involved in initial teacher training for a number of years and is currently leading provision for 10 trainee teachers across 5 Schools. Since 2012, we have worked with cohorts of around 16 and we have an excellent record in recruiting “our” trainees to our immediate cluster and to schools in the local area. Close to 95% of our trainees have secured jobs within teaching. Mills Hill currently employs 7 graduates of our training programme. \r
All schools within the alliance have experienced senior leaders as mentors. They have a friendly and approachable attitude towards training and supporting trainees through the course. They remain in contact with trainees throughout their placements. The alliance offers enhanced training days to support professional development. All students within the cluster train together for the school based training. \r
inst.TrainWithDisability: Direct access to a highly trained senior member of staff enables concerns around disabilities and other needs to be readily addressed.
